properties.name: Old Damascus
properties.description:
There are many historical sites in Damascus, but since it is inhabited to this day, it is very difficult to excavate in the city. The remains of Damascus from the Roman period lie about 5 m. below the current street level, but its layout is preserved to thisday.
In fact the placemark is just above a major straight street, no doubt the "Cardo" of Damascus in the Roman period, known also as the "straight street" from the New Testament (Acts 9:11).
The gate in its eastern end (Bab Sharqi) bears some Roman remains as well, and Near the gate are some architectural remains known by Christian tradition to be the celllar of the house of Ananias (Acts 9).
The oval shapes wall of ancient Damascus are also clearly visible.

For more information about the site:
info@dannythedigger.com
www.dannythedigger.com

properties.name: Coral Island / Ezion Gever?
properties.description:
I kings 22:49: "Now Jehoshaphat built a fleet of trading ships to go to Ophir for gold, but they never set sail—they were wrecked at Ezion Geber.".Perhaps Jehosaphats' flee broke because the port was at this island, and the corals caused the vessels to sink??? this is at least what some scholars think..

For more information about the site:
info@dannythedigger.com
www.dannythedigger.com

properties.name: kadesh Barnea
properties.description:
A Biblical period site in the Egypt, near the border with Israel.
According to the Bible from here Moses sent the spies to tour "the promised land" (Numbers 13).
Later Mirian died and was buried at the site, and Moses created a source of water (Numbers 20).
Excavations at the site revealed a fortress with typical casemet walls.

For more information about the site:
info@dannythedigger.com
www.dannythedigger.com

properties.name: Beerotaim
properties.description:
For more information about the site:

properties.name: Timnah - Model of the Tabernacle
properties.description:
A unique and impressive model of the tabernacle developed by a Christian organization enables a unique echo of the Biblical "moving shrine" of the Israelites.Today it is in the national timnah parks, and can be visited in a guided tour for a low cost.

For more information about the site:
info@dannythedigger.com
www.dannythedigger.com

properties.name: Timnah - Solomon's Pillars
properties.description:
Famous rock formation in Timnah park known by the name "Solomons pillars". On its eastern side a relief of Ramses III was traced, and abutting it from the east a 12th century BCE shrine was recovered, wehere Egyptian goddess Hathor was venarated.

For more information about the site:
info@dannythedigger.com
www.dannythedigger.com

properties.name: Timnah - Visitors Center
properties.description:
A new audio-Visual show at the entrance to Timnah provides a vivid introduction to the unique Timnah national park. highly recommended!.

For more information about the site:
info@dannythedigger.com
www.dannythedigger.com

properties.name: Timnah - The "Mushroom" site
properties.description:
A site in Timnah where a mushroom shaped rock formation has attraced people in antiquity and tourists today.
The mushroom is below the post, and above the post remains of Canaanite period dwellings were dicovered, where some of the copper found at this site was smelted into ingots.

For more information about the site:
info@dannythedigger.com
www.dannythedigger.com

properties.name: Timnah - Ancient Copper Mines and Arch
properties.description:
Set of shafts from Canaanite times dug at the site provide a vivid image of the quest for copper in antiquity. Some of the shafts have been recently opened to the public. Unique geological formations, such as the arch and the mushroom, add special beauty to this archaeological site.

For more information about the site:
info@dannythedigger.com
www.dannythedigger.com

properties.name: Kh. Moa
properties.description:
A roman period fort-station on the "spice route" from Petra to Gaza.
Left of the placemark you can clearly see the square shape of the fortress.
Below the placemark you can see the square shape of the khan as well.

For more information about the site:

www.dannythedigger.com

properties.name: Avdat - Oboda
properties.description:
Ancient site founded by the Nabateans in the heart of the Negev, and named after one of their kings.
The site served the Nabatean camel aravans along the spice route during the Roman period.
In the Byzantine period churches replaced the the Roman-Nabatean shrines, and houses were built and carved into the western cliff.The site was gradually abandoned after the Muslim conquest of the land.

For more information about the site:
http://dannythedigger.com/avdat

properties.name: Halutza - Elusa
properties.description:
Ancient site founded by the Nabateans in the Hellenistic period as a station along the spice road. In the Roman period it developed to a city, from which a theatre is well preserved. In the Byzantine period it was a seat of a bishop and a cathedral from that period was found near the theatre. The site was looted for its stones during the Ottoman period, and the remains are covered in most by sands.Sections of the site were excavated by A. Negev in the 70's of the 20's century, but most of it is still waiting to be revealed.

For more information about the site:
info@dannythedigger.com
www.dannythedigger.com

properties.name: Bor Havarim
properties.description:
A Roman / Nabatean hidden cistern, used also in Byzantine Times.

For more information about the site:
info@dannythedigger.com
www.dannythedigger.com

properties.name: Ancient Gaza / 'Aza
properties.description:
A city known in Biblical times to be member of the Phlishtine Pentapolis.
The Bible records how Samson went to Gazah for sexual entertaiment. He ended up leaving the city with it's gate (Judges 16:1-3).
Later the Philishtines imprisioned him in Gazah, but at the end he pulled down the local temple of Dagon, and slew himself with "all the lords of the Philistines"(Judg. 16:21-30).                                      Gazah was also a major city in Roman times, marking the end of the "Spice route". Here the Nabatean sold the perfumes they carried across the Saudi desert, the merchants who distributed them acrodd the Mediterranean.

For more information about the site:
info@dannythedigger.com
www.dannythedigger.com

properties.name: Nitsana - Nessana
properties.description:
Ancient site on the Border between Israel and Egypt. It was originally founded by the Nabateans, but most of the visible remains are from the Byzatine period (4th to 7th century CE).The site was exacavated by Colt in the 1930's, whose most important find was an archive from the 6th-8th century.
The site was re-developed as an adminstrative center in the 19th century by the turks, from which one structure remains on the top of the acropolis (Exactly the placemark is).
The ancient visible finds today include three churches, a ceremonial stair-case, and two cistern.

For more information about the site:
info@dannythedigger.com
www.dannythedigger.com

properties.description:
For more information about the site:
info@dannythedigger.com

properties.name: Mizpe Shivtah
properties.description:
An isolated hill near shivtah, that was perhaps inhabited by monks during the Byzantine period, and was known by the name "St. Georgius' inn".
The site was excavted by Y. Baumgarten in 1970.

For more information about the site:
http://dannythedigger.com/shivta

properties.name: Shivtah - Even Ari's Farm
properties.description:
North of Shivtah prof. Aven Ari conducted a succesful experiment to demonstrate that by clever water systems as done in antiquity, various fruits can be grown also today.
The site is today unattented, but as you can see ,even from space(..), the trees continue to blossom.
A similar farm, on a larger scale, was created at Avdat.

For more information about the site:
http://dannythedigger.com/shivta

properties.name: Tuleilat el Anab
properties.description:
Mysterious ancient site in the negev where many sets of stones are piled in even gaps (Quite clearly visible from this angle!).
Scholars argue the function of this piles of stones. Some say they are for grape vines, while others argue they are meant to improve floew of the rare rains into cistern.

For more information about the site:
http://dannythedigger.com/shivta

properties.name: Shivtah - Sobota
properties.description:
Amazingly preserved site in the Negev from Roman and Byzantine period. It was founded by the Nabateans, but the visible remains are mostly form the Byzantine period. They include three churches (!), a water reservoir, and various houses with streets between them. Being a very isolated spot, it was never re-ihnabited or looted since antiquitiy. A visit to the site gives a unique feeling of going through a time machine!.Partially excavated by Colt in the 1930's.

For more information about the site:
http://dannythedigger.com/shivta

properties.name: Shivtah - the Winepress
properties.description:
The size of the wine press, and this is only one of many found in the Negev, indicates grape groves once covered large areas around the ancient negev cities.

For more information about the site:
http://dannythedigger.com/shivta

properties.name: Shivtah - The middle church
properties.description:
For more information about the site:
http://dannythedigger.com/shivta

properties.name: Shivtah - The Monastic Northern Church

properties.name: Ruheibah - Rechovot in the Negev
properties.description:
Beautifully preserved Roman-Byzantine period site in the Negev. Partial excavations by Y. Tsafrir in the 1970's revealed a few houses, churches, and tombs. Just left of the placemark the bright structure is the ancient church of the site.Access to the site is possible only by 4x4, but the effort is rewarding! walking in the site feels like walking in a time machine..

For more information about the site:
info@dannythedigger.com
www.dannythedigger.com

Around the church a large contemporary cemetary was excavated.

For more information about the site:
info@dannythedigger.com
www.dannythedigger.com

properties.name: Kh. Sa'adon
properties.description:
The Smallest Nabatean site in the Negev, 4km east of Rechovot. It was inhabited during the Byzantine period, and deserted after the Arab conquest.
The site hasn't been excavated yet.

For more information about the site:
info@dannythedigger.com

Used to this day by local Bedouins.

www.dannythedigger.com

properties.description:
So suggested A. Negev in the 1970's     

For more information about the site:
info@dannythedigger.com
www.dannythedigger.com

properties.name: Caesarea - The ancient Theatre
properties.description:
At the southern edge of ancient Caesarea, and right next to his "palace on the sea", Herod consturcted a large theatre which is still active to this day (!).
Excavations at the site in the 1960's revealed an inscription at the site mentioning "Pontius Pilatus", the famed local goverenor of Provinkia Ivdaea who gave order to crucify the founder of the Christianity.

For more information about the site:
http://dannythedigger.com/caesarea

properties.name: Caesarea - The Western Hippodrome
properties.description:
A large hippodrome was discovered right next to the sea in ancient Caesarea in the 1990's. In fact it was too close to the sea, and so the western part was "eaten" by the sea already in antiquity, causing the construction of another hippodrome more inland.

For more information about the site:
http://dannythedigger.com/caesarea

properties.name: Paul's prison in Caesarea???
properties.description:
Though the book of acts states Paul was held "in the palace" at Caesarea before sent to trial in Rome, most likely he was held in the local prison. Indeed right next to the palace of Caesarea excavators found a Latin inscription indicating a local police station was placed right here. It is quite possible therefor that this is where Paul was kept for nearly two years (!!). If the site was held by the Franciscans most likelyt a memorial church would be created at this spot, yet today even the insctription is not visible, and only by reading excavation reports can one appriciate the full significance of this spot!.

For more information about the site:
http://dannythedigger.com/caesarea

properties.name: Caesarea - Herod's palace on the sea
properties.description:
Another daring building project by Herod to construct a palace on a cliff, providing beauty and security at the same time, and close to cultural centers such as the theatre and the Hippodrome.Mosaics revealed at the site are today all covered, but the pool of the palace (right beloe the placemark) is clearly visible.

For more information about the site:
http://dannythedigger.com/caesarea

properties.name: Ancient Entrance to the Port of Caesarea
properties.description:
The ancient entrance to the port of Caesarea was adorned with big sculptures of the family of Heord. Many fruitless attempts were made to recover these sculpture, and the assumptions is that they were looted already in antiquity.

For more information about the site:
http://dannythedigger.com/caesarea

properties.name: Caesarea - The Byzantine Tax archive
properties.description:
A large complex found in the center of ancient Caesarea was adorned with many mosaic floors, some praising local clerqs. It is presumed this was the local tax archive, perhaps of the whole province.

For more information about the site:
http://dannythedigger.com/caesarea

properties.name: Caesarea - The "Augusteum"
properties.description:
At this very spot, right against the port, Herod constructed a large shrine in honoe of Augustus. In the Byzantine period it was transformed into an octagonal church, perhaps to commemorate cornelius, the Roman officer known from the book of Acts.

For more information about the site:
http://dannythedigger.com/caesarea

properties.name: Caesarea "Maritima"
properties.description:
https://www.youtube.com/embed/cD4PYMht-bg

The city which was founded in the 1st century BCE and named in honor of Augustus, was re-fortified by the Louis IX during one of the last crusades.But it was all in vain - in 1265 Baybars simply attacked the fortress from several spots simultaneously, and the crusaders did not have enough men power to hold the attack back. Though Baybars "erased the site to the ground" the crusaders period fortfications (clearly seen as a rectangular shape on all sides of the place mark) are well preserved and are very impressive.Right below the placemark remains of a large Cathedral from the time of the crusaders was also found.

For more information about the site:
http://dannythedigger.com/caesarea

properties.name: Caesarea - The Eastern Hippodrome
properties.description:
After it's first Hippodrome was "eaten" by the sea, the people of Caesarea built a new Hippodrome inland. The site has not yet been excavated, but the broken obelisk which adorned the center of the structure has been recently placed in its original location.

For more information about the site:
http://dannythedigger.com/caesarea

properties.name: Caesarea - The Ancient Synagogue
properties.description:
Right against the sea, in the 1970's a team from the Hebrew University discovered remains of an ancient synagogues, probably one of a few that were in ancient Caesarea.

For more information about the site:
http://dannythedigger.com/caesarea

properties.name: Caesarea - The Northern Walls and Gate
properties.description:
At this spot remains of the northern walls and gate of ancient Caesarea are still visble after been exposed by archaeologists in the 1970's.

For more information about the site:
http://dannythedigger.com/caesarea

properties.name: Caesarea - The Ampitheatre
properties.description:
On the northern-eastern edge of ancient Caesarea the remains of its ampitheatre can be seen, but the sturcture is still waiting to be revealed.

For more information about the site:
http://dannythedigger.com/caesarea

properties.name: Caesarea - The "Birds" Mosaic
properties.description:
A site on the edge of ancient Caesarea where a big mosaic floor wes deiscovered by chance in the 1950's. in 2004-5 it was re-exposed and opened to the public. It may have been part of the mansion of the Governor of the provine in the Byzantine period.

For more information about the site:
http://dannythedigger.com/caesarea

properties.name: Caesarea - The "High" Aquaduct
properties.description:
Beatiful spot on the shore of Caesarea where a big section of the ancient "high" aquaduct is preserved. The water came from shuni springs in the Carmel mountains, and were carried on a bridge near the sea to reach the city in a proper altitude.An additional, "lower" aquaduct was added east of the "high"aquduct (Just look for my other spot, 50 m to the right).

For more information about the site:
http://dannythedigger.com/caesarea

properties.name: Caesarea  - The "Low" Aquaduct
properties.description:
A well preserved section of an aquduct that brought water to ancient Caesarea. It was probably constructed in the Early Arab period.

For more information about the site:
http://dannythedigger.com/caesarea

properties.name: Section of the Ancient Aquaduct to Caesarea
properties.description:
A site on the sde of the Tel-Aviv - Haifa HWY where a section of the ancient aquduct to Caesarea is clearly visible.

For more information about the site:
http://dannythedigger.com/caesarea

properties.name: Shuni
properties.description:
A Roman-Byzantine period site where a well preserves theatre is visible to this day. Historical sources indicate that in antiquity wine festivals which included orgies flourished at the site.

For more information about the site:
info@dannythedigger.com
www.dannythedigger.com

properties.name: Park Alona - Ancient Aquaduct to Caesarea
properties.description:
A site along the ancient aquaduct to Caesarea developed for tourism, thus visitors can experience walking in the tunnel for 40 m, getting their feet wet. Great experience!

For more information about the site:
info@dannythedigger.com
www.dannythedigger.com

properties.name: Caesarea - The "Farmers Blessings" Mosaic
properties.description:
For more information about the site:
http://dannythedigger.com/caesarea

properties.name: Caesarea - The "Byzantine Street"
properties.description:
A Byzantine period public street decorated with two larger then human scale stone sculptures, one of Zeus and one of Hadrian.

For more information about the site:
http://dannythedigger.com/caesarea

properties.name: Tel JalJul / Biblical Gilgal?
properties.description:
A site proposed to be the location of Biblical Gilgal (Joshua 5, 1 Sam. 11:14-15, 2 Sam. 19:1, 2 Kings 2:2, 4:38, etc.) It is both "at the eastern edge of Jericho (Joshua 4:19); the site's Arabic name is "Tel Jaljul" (also "al-Alala"), and according to surveys conducted in the area it bears pottery from the Canaaninte and Israelite periods, and mostly remains from the Byzantine period. This fits perfectly the Byzantine period accounts of a church built to commemorate the site (Madaba map, Boureaux pilgrim, Theodosius, Antoninus, and more).

For more information about the site:
info@dannythedigger.com
www.dannythedigger.com

properties.name: Khirbet el-Mafjar
properties.description:
A palaca complex from the early Arab period that was never completed because of the devastating earth quate of 749 CE.
Below the placemark you can clearly see the palace complex. Above the placemark the Bathhouse complex is also clearly visible.

For more information about the site:
http://dannythedigger.com/hishams-palace-khirbat-al-mafjar

properties.name: Dok / Dagon
properties.description:
A Hasmonean fortress on a hill above Jericho.
In the late 19th century the Greek-Orthodox church started building a church complex at the site. The work was never completed, and so you can see clearly under the placemark the unfinished church, and the wall around.

For more information about the site:
info@dannythedigger.com
www.dannythedigger.com

properties.name: Mt. of Temptation
properties.description:
Holy Christian site of the traditional site where JEsus was tempted by Satan after his Baptism.In recent years a cable car was installed to access comfortably the site.

For more information about the site:
info@dannythedigger.com
www.dannythedigger.com

properties.name: Biblical Jericho
properties.description:
Biblical site famous for being the first Canaanite to be taken by the Israelites after crossing the Jordan (Jos. 6).The site was excavated by various archaeologists. The most famous dig at the site was conducted by K. Kenyon, who revealed Neolithic period architecture, which make Jericho the oldest city on earth. Being 300 m below sea level, Jericho is also the oldest city on earth.

For more information about the site:
http://dannythedigger.com/biblical-jericho

properties.name: Elijah's Spring
properties.description:
For more information about the site:
http://dannythedigger.com/elishas-spring-ain-al-sultan

properties.name: Tell es-Samarat / Jericho's Hippodrome
properties.description:
A site 1 km north of The Herodian palaces complex where by the aid of aerial photos a contemorary multi-purpose entertiament structure was identified.
It was excavated in the 1975-6 by E. Netser who analysed the site as a combined theater and hippodrome complex.
The position of the placemark enables you to see clearly the layout of the hippodrome with the sitting zone / theatre in its northern edge.

For more information about the site:
http://dannythedigger.com/tulul-abu-el-alaiyq

properties.name: Jericho's Ancient Cemetary
properties.description:
Excavations in the white lime stone hill east of Jericho revealed Jewish cave tombs from the Roman period.
One of the stone coffins revealed was inscribed "Goliath", and indeed the boned found inside were of a very tall person.
"Goliath" must have been his nickname, named after the famed large size Philishtine warrior that was killed by David.
Apperently his nickname overran his real name when he was alive, and in his death.

For more information about the site:
info@dannythedigger.com
www.dannythedigger.com

properties.name: Herods' winter palaces in Jericho
properties.description:
Roman period palatial complex built by the Hasmoneans and expanded by King Herod. Thoroughly excavated by E. Netzer in the 1970's.

For more information about the site:
http://dannythedigger.com/tulul-abu-el-alaiyq

properties.name: St. George Monastery
properties.description:
https://www.youtube.com/embed/gegVPC_bRCs

A monastery in Wadi Qilt founded in the Byzantine period by a monk called Georgius.It is one of the few Christian monasteries inhabited to this day, and the most beautiful of them in my ipinion.

For more information about the site:
http://dannythedigger.com/saint-george-monastery

properties.name: Kypros
properties.description:
One of Herods' fortresses in the desert, named after his mother.Excavated by E. Netzer in the 1970's. The finds include a a bath house and a huge marble bath tab (!).

For more information about the site:
info@dannythedigger.com
www.dannythedigger.com

properties.name: The Good Samaritan inn
properties.description:
https://www.youtube.com/embed/Okgo3o9qdeA

Below the placemark is a chapell on the side of the road between Jerusalem and Jericho, sanctifing the supposed location of the inn where the "Good Samaritan" aided the wounded person (Luke 10:25-37). Recently the site was excavated by Y. Magen, and plans are to open at the site a regional archaeological museum.Right of the placemark is a crusaders period fortress, still waiting to be excavated.

For more information about the site:
http://dannythedigger.com/good-samaritan-inn

properties.name: Eusebius' Monastery
properties.description:
https://www.youtube.com/embed/JwDGZ6CtChI

Monastic complex in the Judean Desert founded by Eusebius in the 5th century. Intended originally to be an isolated spot, strangly enough today it is in the center of an Israeli industrial area..The site was Excavated by Y. Magen and Y. Hirschfeld in the 1990's, and was fixed for visitation by E. Maharian.

For more information about the site:
http://dannythedigger.com/euthymius-monastery

properties.name: Martyrius' Monastery
properties.description:
https://www.youtube.com/embed/57J5Q2jGBTY

Large monastic complex in the Judean desert founded by Martyrius in the 5th century CE. Although intended to be in an isolated spot, today it is strangly located in the center of a big Israeli suburn of Jerusalem..Excavated by Y. Magen in the 1980's and open to the public.

For more information about the site:
http://dannythedigger.com/matryrius-monastery

properties.name: Nebi Musa
properties.description:
Burial site of Moses according to Muslims tradition, althougth it clearly contricts the Biblical narrative.Developed into a khan in middle ages, and was a destination of Muslim pilgrimage parades in the 19th and early 20th century.

For more information about the site:
info@dannythedigger.com
www.dannythedigger.com

properties.name: Mar Elias Monastery
properties.description:
Monastery on the side of the road from Jerusalem to Bethlehem. It is named after Elias, Patriach of Jerusalem in the 14th century, who is buried in this monastery.
but later a local tradition developed that on the rock south of the monastery (to the left of the placemark) Elijah rested while escaping to Mt. Horev after slaughtering the Baal Prophets on the carmel (I Kings 19, look for placemark "Muchraka"!).

For more information about the site:
http://dannythedigger.com/mar-elias-monastery

properties.name: Kathisma Church
properties.description:
https://www.youtube.com/embed/FIhiaHPuZGs

A site revealed by accident in the 1900's while working on the main road between Jerusalem and Bethlehem. Above the placemark you can clearly see the octagonal shaped church, which was built in the Byzantine period over a rock, whee according to Christian tradition Mary set (=Khtistos) to rest while on way to Bethlehem, where she would deliver Jesus.
Below the placemakr is "Bir Kadsimo" which preserved the ancient name of the site.

For more information about the site:
http://dannythedigger.com/kathisma

properties.name: Ramat Rachel
properties.description:
Archaeological site south of Jerusalem where Y. Aharoni revealed in the 1906's an Israelite period palace, and a Byzantine period monastery.Aharoni believed the Monastery is the site of "Katisma", but in the 1990's the real Katisma was found a bit south (look for it!).The Israelite palace is perhaps mentioned in Jeremiah 22:14.

For more information about the site:
http://dannythedigger.com/ramat-rachel-archaeological-site

properties.name: Tunnel of the "Lower Aquaduct"
properties.description:
The ancient Aquaduct that brought water to Jerusalem in antiquity from springs in the area of Hebron had to pass the "mount of Evil council" in a tunnel. At the top of this ventilation shaft of the tunnel the municipality of Jerusalem created a mosaic floor that provides a map and explanations about the water system of Jerusalem in the Roman period.

For more information about the site:
http://dannythedigger.com/hasmonean-water-tunnel-armon-hanatziv

properties.name: City of David
properties.description:
https://www.youtube.com/embed/U98PC9wtFaA

Ancient Jerusalem, the site where David formed the united Kingdon during the Israelite period.
The Site has been surveyed and excavated by various expeditions, the most known ones were of Charles Warren and Yigeal Shiloh.Recent excavations by E. Mazar may have found the palace of David.

For more information about the site:
http://dannythedigger.com/city-of-david

properties.name: Kidron Valley
properties.description:
The valley east of the old city of Jersualem. Known also by the name YEHOSAPHAT (=God will judge), according to Jewish religion in this very valley all souls will assemble at the end of days..One day it is going to be quite crowded over here...

For more information about the site:
info@dannythedigger.com
www.dannythedigger.com

properties.name: Binianei Haumah - Roman Ceramic industrial zone
properties.description:
A Roman period ceramic workshop which was operated by the tenth legion. It is under an intl. convention center, yet preserved and displayed well through glass floors.

For more information about the site:
http://dannythedigger.com/tenth-legion-ceramics-workshop-under-israel-convention-center

properties.name: Quarry of the Herodian Temple
properties.description:
A unique ancient quarry discovered on 9.2007 in northern Jerusalem. Trenches created in the bed rock indicate the stones extracted at the site were of colossal size. Some were 8 m long. Small finds date the quarry to the first century CE. It seems that this quarry produced some of the stones used to re-build the Jewish temple in Jerusalem in the time of king Herod. Though relatively far from the construction site, it is on a heigher elevation.

For more information about the site:
info@dannythedigger.com
www.dannythedigger.com

properties.name: Anatot / Anata
properties.description:
Biblical site, which was the hometown of prophet Jeremiah (1:1). The name of the site is preserved to this day, as the name of the Arab village at the site is ANATA.No excavation conducted yet at site. Jeremiahs' home is still waiting to be discovered!.

For more information about the site:
info@dannythedigger.com
www.dannythedigger.com

properties.name: Dominus Flevit Church
properties.description:
Holy Christian site where "The Lord wept" (Dominus Flevit) (Luke 19:37-42)
Excavations at the site by the Franciscian revealed a big tomb complex from the first century. They argue some of the cross signs found in the caves were made by the very first Judeo-Christian, but this theory is baseless.

For more information about the site:
http://dannythedigger.com/dominus-flevit-church

properties.name: "Viri Galilee" Church
properties.description:
Monastic complex at the presumed site where people from Galilee stood and watched Jesus as he ascended to heaven (Acts 1:9-11).
Just left of the placemark you can clearly see the cruciform church at the site.

For more information about the site:
info@dannythedigger.com
www.dannythedigger.com

properties.name: Chapel of the Ascension
properties.description:
A Holy Christian site on the top of Mt. of Olives from where supposdly Jesus ascended to heaven (Luke 24:50-53). Just left of the placemark you can clearly see the round chapell built over the rock from where Jesus ascended. Tthe depression in the center of the rock inside the chappell was supposdly caused by Jesus' foot when he ascended.

For more information about the site:
http://dannythedigger.com/chapel-of-the-ascension

properties.name: Bethpage - The Catholic Church
properties.description:
https://www.youtube.com/embed/6KRHfMYoEN0

A Holy christian site east Jerusalem, from where Jesus entered the city on a donkey (Mat. 21:1-11). Just below the placemark you can see the red roof of the church at the spot.

For more information about the site:
http://dannythedigger.com/bethphage

properties.name: Bethany - Tomb of Lazarus
properties.description:
An ancient village east of Jerusalem, where Jesus brought a man named Lazarus back to life.
The placemark is right over the remains of a crusaders period monastery. The white rof NE of the placemark is of the church over the supposed tomb of Lazarus.

For more information about the site:
info@dannythedigger.com
www.dannythedigger.com

properties.name: Seat of Jesus / Burj el Ahmar
properties.description:
A Holy christian site on the side of the road to Jerusalem where a rock is venarated. Supposdly Jesus sat on the rock when Mary saw him (John 11:32).
The Arabs call the place "Burge el Ahmar" - "Fortress of the ass".. and there are no remains of a fortress at the site...

For more information about the site:
info@dannythedigger.com
www.dannythedigger.com

properties.name: Nebi Samuel / Ramah
properties.description:
Biblical site, perhaps "Ramah", where the prophet Samuel lived and was buried.The crusaders coming from Europe saw from here Jerusalem for the first time and so called the mountain "montjoie" (mount of joy).They also re-fortified the site and built a cathedral , in which the supposed tomb os Samuel is venarated both by Muslims and Jews.
Jer. 31:14 mey indicate a tradition that Rachel was also buried here.
Largs scale exacavations at the site by Y. Magen revealed most of the Crsaders period fortifications, which are quite visible thru GE.

For more information about the site:
http://dannythedigger.com/nabi-samuil

properties.name: Gibeah / Tell el-Full
properties.description:
Biblical site fmaed as Saul's hometown (Judges 10:26.), Yet Judges 19 record how the people of Gibeah have bad hospitality manners - they slaughtered a concubine of a passanger...The site was partially excavated by Albright in 1922-3, and by Lapp in 1964.Hussein king of Jordan started building a palace at the site, but the six day war in 1967 put his plans to avail. After the peace accord in 1994 Israel offered Hussein to complete his palace, but it was not done.

For more information about the site:
info@dannythedigger.com
www.dannythedigger.com

properties.name: Ancient Purity stone vessels cave
properties.description:
An ancient quarry discovered by chance when constructing a new road under the saddle between mount of Olives and Mount Scopus. The finds recovered in the cave attest that during the Second Temple Period (2nd CEN BCE-1st CEN CE) purity stone vessels were produced here.

For more information about the site:
info@dannythedigger.com
www.dannythedigger.com

properties.name: The Dispiles spring / Ein Shams
properties.description:
A spring East of Jerusalem believed to be on the ancient road from Jericho to Jerusalem. By local Tradition Jesus and disiples rested at the spot, on their way to Jerusalem.
The spring is in private property, but near it remains of a Roman-Byzantine period structure can be seen.

For more information about the site:
info@dannythedigger.com
www.dannythedigger.com

properties.name: Givon / Gibeon
properties.description:
Biblical site, known as the place where the sun stood still (Joshua 10:12). The site was excavated by J. Pritchard in the early 20th century, who revealed storage caves for wine jars, and a water system.

For more information about the site:
info@dannythedigger.com
www.dannythedigger.com

properties.name: Qubur Benei Issrail
properties.description:
Mysterious ancient site NE of Jerusalem, whose name indicates a local tradition this is the tomb site of the "Sons of Israel".
The site is really a set of narrow rectangular stone structures. Four of them are clearly visible even thru GE!.Excavations at the site by Abels in the 1990's revealed Roman-Byzantine period pottery.
Based on Sam. 10:2, some scholars argue the site was identified as Rachels' tomb in Biblical times.

For more information about the site:
info@dannythedigger.com
www.dannythedigger.com

properties.name: Hizmah stone vessels cave
properties.description:
Site NE of Jerusalem which in the first century CE was a quarry for stone vessels, which according to Jewish religious law at that time were considered to be immune from impurity.The site was excavated in the 1970's by Y. Magen.

For more information about the site:
info@dannythedigger.com
www.dannythedigger.com

properties.name: Geva / Jaba
properties.description:
Biblical site from where Saul and Yonathan campaigned against the Philistines, who were stationed in near by Michmash (I Sam. 13:16). The name of the site is preserved to this day, as the name of the Arab village at the site is JABA.

For more information about the site:
info@dannythedigger.com
www.dannythedigger.com

properties.name: Michmash / Muchmas
properties.description:
Biblical site where the Philistines camped before confronting Saul and Yonathan and their army (I Sam. 13:16). The name of the site is preserved to this day, as the name of the Arab village at the site is MUCHMAS.

For more information about the site:
info@dannythedigger.com
www.dannythedigger.com

properties.name: Kh. el Lattatin
properties.description:
A site NW of Jerusalem identied as "The site of the ninth mile" mentioned in Madaba map ( "TOENNA" (http://www.christusrex.org/www1/ofm/mad/legends/legends061.html)).
The idendification is based mostly on the similar sound of the name, though the meaning of the name of the site in Arabic is "kilns", and indeed kilns were found at the site.

For more information about the site:
info@dannythedigger.com
www.dannythedigger.com

properties.name: Mitzpah / Tel es-Nasbeh
properties.description:
Biblical site, whose name ("Mitzpah"=observatory) derives from its location. The place was fortified by king Asah (I Kings 15:22), and after the destruction of Jerusalem in 586 BCE Nebbuchadnezar made Mitzpah capital of Judah (II Kings 25:23). The site was excavated by a Danish team in 1926-1935.The name of the site is preserved to this day, as Arabic name of the site is Tel es-Nasbeh.

For more information about the site:
info@dannythedigger.com
www.dannythedigger.com

properties.name: Motsah - Emmaus?
properties.description:
A site near Jerusalem Identified by the Dominicans as Emmaus mentioned in Luke 24. Indeed the name of the site today, Motsah, is perhaps preserving the old name of the site (Emmaus), but while the New Testament states Emmause should be 11 km away from Jerusalem, Motsah is only about 6 km west of the old city (check for yourself with the ruler tool!)

For more information about the site:
info@dannythedigger.com
www.dannythedigger.com

properties.name: Ein Kerem - John Baharim Church
properties.description:
Franciscian church in Ein Kerem over the house where according to Christian tradition John grew up.
Excavations at the site revealed remains of a Byzantine period church, and a Roman period house, including sculptures of pagan gods. Yet a an ancient purity pool (Mikveh) discovered by the excavators atessts that indeed Jews dwelt at the site.
The church was built by the Royal Spanish family, and so its interior design has a spanish special style.

For more information about the site:
http://dannythedigger.com/john-baharim-church

properties.name: Ein Kerem - Mary's Spring
properties.description:
The spring in the center of Ein Kerem is named after Mary, perhaps because she stopped here to drink while on her way to visit Elizabeth, at the site known today as "Church of Visitation".

For more information about the site:
info@dannythedigger.com
www.dannythedigger.com

properties.name: Ein Kerem-Church of Visitation
properties.description:
Church complex on the fringe of the village of Ein Kerem where according to Christian tradition Mary came to visit Elizabeth when they were both pregnant (Luke 1:39-56).
Mary's blessing to Elizabeth, "The magnificate", is presented in many languages in plaques fixed in the courtyard.
The modern church, planned by Berluzzi, bears big and rich in details wall frescoes.

For more information about the site:
http://dannythedigger.com/visitation-church

properties.name: "John in the Desert" Monastery
properties.description:
A site on a steep hill below moshav Even Sapir Identified as the desert where John spent time: "So the child grew up and became strong in spirit, AND WAS IN THE DESERTS till the day of his manifastation to Israel"(Luke 1:80).
As you can see (even from space..) the trees around the monastery testify that the site is not even close to any wilderness..
I guess tradition sometimes has a power of its own..

For more information about the site:
info@dannythedigger.com
www.dannythedigger.com

properties.name: John the Baptist cave at Tsuba
properties.description:
Biblical period water reservoir re-used in Roman times, and developed into a site for veneration of John the Baptist in the Byzantine period.The excavator of the site, S. Gibson, argues that John the baptist indeed used the site, but his evidence are not convincing enough. Nevertheless, since open to the public (2004) the site attracts many pilgims.

For more information about the site:
info@dannythedigger.com
www.dannythedigger.com

properties.name: Tzuba - Belmont
properties.description:
Biblical site on the mountains of Judah. It was re-fortified by the crusaders, and renamed as "Belmont" (Beautiful mountain), perhaps because the perfect round shape of the hill reminded them of their wives left behind in Europe..

For more information about the site:
info@dannythedigger.com
www.dannythedigger.com

properties.name: Abu Gosh - Crusaders' Church
properties.description:
Holy Christian place which marks the Crusaders tradition of the site where Jesus appeared after his resurrection (Luke 24:13-20). The church preserves crusaders period frescoes, as well as a Roman period military inscription.

For more information about the site:
http://dannythedigger.com/abu-gosh-crusaders-period-church

properties.name: El Kubeibah - Emmaus?
properties.description:
A site 11 kn from Jerusalem Identifed by the Franciscians as "Emmaus" mentioned in Luke 24.
Excavations at the site revealed Crusader period village and church.

For more information about the site:
info@dannythedigger.com
www.dannythedigger.com

properties.name: Ein El-Haniah / Phillip's Spring?
properties.description:
This spring on the side of the road going from Jerusalem to Gaza is identified by some as the spring where Phiiip baptised an Ethiopian Eunuch (Acts 8).

For more information about the site:
info@dannythedigger.com
www.dannythedigger.com

properties.name: Beitar
properties.description:
A site 11 km SW of Jerusalem where a crucial battle between Bar-Kokhva's people and the Romans took place (135 CE).
The name of the site is preserved in the Arabic name of the village nearby - "Battir".

For more information about the site:
info@dannythedigger.com
www.dannythedigger.com

properties.name: Rachels' Tomb
properties.description:
Traditional site of the burial place of Rachel, which indeed should be on the road to Bethlehem (Genesis 35:19). I hope Google earth will improve the sat. image so the building can be seen.

For more information about the site:
http://dannythedigger.com/rachels-tomb

properties.name: "Solomons' pools"
properties.description:
Nickname to a grand set of pools between Hebron and Bethlehem whic was part of the water system to supply water to Jerusalem in Roman times.

For more information about the site:
info@dannythedigger.com
www.dannythedigger.com

properties.name: Bethlehem - Church of the Nativity
properties.description:
The Traditional location of the birth place of Jesus. The first church was built at the site by Constantine, and later it was renovated by Justinian II. The Crusaders added some wall paintings, still visible at the site. I challange Google earth to provide a better image of the site, without the clouds!.

For more information about the site:
http://dannythedigger.com/church-of-nativity-in-bethlehem

properties.name: The Shepherds' fields
properties.description:
Site east of the Church of Nativity in Bethlehem, known as "the Shphereds' fields" ("And there were shepherds living out in the fields nearby, keeping watch over their flocks at night" Luke 2:10).A small chapell round adorns the site. Its shape echos a tent, to symbolize the probable swellings of the shepherds.
The Greek-Orthodix identify the "Shepherds' fields" a bit to the south (try finding it yourself!), where remains of Byzantine complex were revealed.

For more information about the site:
http://dannythedigger.com/shepherds-fields

properties.name: Theodosius' monastery
properties.description:
A monastic complex inhabited continiously since the Byzantine period. The rectanguler shape of the complex can be seen clearly to the left of the placemark.
The red roofed structure is the church of the monastery.
The site is closed for visitors.

For more information about the site:
info@dannythedigger.com
www.dannythedigger.com

properties.name: Herodium / Herodion
properties.description:
https://www.youtube.com/embed/Ap4909J5mJY

Herods' palace, fortress, and burial site, which he humbly named after - him self. Excavations at the site revealed much of the fortresss, the lower city, and churches.
The placemark it right over the stadium. To the left (=to the west) you can see clearly the ancient pool, which was designed with an artificial "island" in its center.

For more information about the site:
http://dannythedigger.com/herodium-herodion

properties.name: Herodium - "Herod's Tomb"
properties.description:
https://www.youtube.com/embed/Ap4909J5mJY

A sensational discovery made in 2007, when Prof. E. Netzer announced the finding of Herod's tomb on Herodium. Not all agree on this identification (including me), and I am a member of a group suggesting an alternative location.

For more information about the site:
http://dannythedigger.com/herodium-herodion

properties.name: Mar Saba / Sabas Monastery
properties.description:
A monastic complex in the Kidron valley inhabited continiously since the Byzantine period.
It was founded by Sabas in the fifth century, and he is buried in the complex.
The site is open only for males..

For more information about the site:
info@dannythedigger.com
www.dannythedigger.com

properties.name: Hyrkania
properties.description:
Hasmonean fortress from 2nd-1st century BCE.
The Satellite view shows clearly the fortress and water aquaduct abbuting the site fron the west.
O. Gotfeld is exposing a tunnel below the site, which might make world head-lines!!..

For more information about the site:
info@dannythedigger.com
www.dannythedigger.com

properties.name: Jabel Muntar / Azazel?
properties.description:
The possible site where the annual Jewish ceremony of the sacrifice of the escape goat took place (Lev. 16:10-22).

For more information about the site:
info@dannythedigger.com
www.dannythedigger.com

properties.name: Maldoim / Khan el-Hatruri
properties.description:
Crusaders Fortress on the road from Jeruslem to Jericho

For more information about the site:
info@dannythedigger.com
www.dannythedigger.com

properties.name: Bethphage - The Greek-Orthodox Church
properties.description:
https://www.youtube.com/embed/6KRHfMYoEN0

For more information about the site:
http://dannythedigger.com/bethphage

properties.name: Mount of Olives - The Russian Church
properties.description:
For more information about the site:
http://dannythedigger.com/russian-church-of-the-ascension

properties.name: Pater Noster Church
properties.description:
For more information about the site:
http://dannythedigger.com/church-of-the-pater-noster

properties.name: Kidron Valley Tombs
properties.description:
For more information about the site:
http://dannythedigger.com/kidron-valley-tombs

properties.name: Garden of Gethsemane
properties.description:
For more information about the site:
http://dannythedigger.com/garden-of-gethsemane

properties.name: Tomb of Mary
properties.description:
For more information about the Site:
http://dannythedigger.com/marys-tomb

properties.name: Grotto of Gethsemane
properties.description:
For more information about the site:
http://dannythedigger.com/grotto-of-gethsemane

properties.name: Pools of Bethesdah
properties.description:
For more information about the site:
http://dannythedigger.com/bethesda

properties.name: Franciscan Archaeological Museum
properties.description:
For more information about the site:
http://dannythedigger.com/franciscan-museum

properties.name: "Praetorium"?
properties.description:
Site of the trial of Jesus by Christian tradition.

For more information about the site:
info@dannythedigger.com
www.dannythedigger.com

properties.name: "Via Dolorosa" / Stations of the Cross
properties.description:
For more information about the site:
http://dannythedigger.com/via-dolorosa

properties.name: Church of the Holy Sepulchre
properties.description:
https://www.youtube.com/embed/j3cZ-nC2FY0

For more information about the site:
http://dannythedigger.com/holy-sepulchre

properties.name: Dome of the Rock
properties.description:
For more information about the site:
http://dannythedigger.com/dome-of-the-rock

properties.name: Temple Mount
properties.description:
For more information about the site:
http://dannythedigger.com/temple-mount

properties.name: The Western Wall
properties.description:
For more information about the site:

properties.description:
Site in the Arab village of Abu-Gosh believed by Christian Tradition to be Biblical "Kiryat Yaarim".
For more information about the site:
http://dannythedigger.com/notre-dame-de-larche-dalliance

properties.name: Beth-el / Beitin
properties.description:
Biblical site whose name is preserved to this day (Beitin). Famous for being the site of Jacobs' dream (Genesis 28:10-22). Jeroboam installed a worship center at the site for a golden calf (I Kings 12:28-29), but the local altar was demolished by divine power (I Kings 13:1-11), and later again by Josiah (II Kings 23:15). Albright who excavated at the site claimed to find stones stained with blood, perhaps remnants of the Biblical altar.

For more information about the site:
info@dannythedigger.com
www.dannythedigger.com

properties.name: et-Tell / Ai
properties.description:
Both in Arabic and in Hebrew the meaning of the name is "ruins". And indeed the site was turned into ruins by Joshua (Joshua 8).But archaeological investigation at the site revealed finds from the Early Bronze age, some 1000 years before Joshua!. This site is one of the most important sites for Bible study and its historiography.

For more information about the site:
info@dannythedigger.com
www.dannythedigger.com

properties.name: Kh. el-Beidath / Archelais?
properties.description:
An ancient site on the side of the main road of the Jordan valley. Excavations at the site revealed a Jewish village from the Roman period. Perhaps this is "Archelais", the site founded by Archelaus, son of Herod, in Jericho's valley.

For more information about the site:
info@dannythedigger.com
www.dannythedigger.com

properties.name: Tel Shiloh
properties.description:
Famous Biblical site in Samaria. The site was the center of the Israelites in the days of Joshua and the tent of meeting was placed at the site (Joshua 18:1). Amasingly to this day, and especially from the air, one can spot a large rectangular space on the northern side of the tell, just in the right size for the tent of the Meeting!!.

For more information about the site:
info@dannythedigger.com
www.dannythedigger.com

properties.name: Sartaba / Alexandrion
properties.description:
Hasmonean fortress in Samaria named after the Maccanean king Alexander Janneaus (103-76 BCE). It was also the site from where light signals would notify the Jews in Babylon of the new month.

For more information about the site:
info@dannythedigger.com
www.dannythedigger.com

properties.name: Mt. Grizim
properties.description:
Holy mountain to the Samaritans, and a big archaeological site. Large scales excavations by Y. Magen revealed Ancient Samaritans dwellings and parrts of the ancient Samaritan temple. To this day the Samaritans performe the traditional pass-over ceremony at the site, which attracts many tourists.

For more information about the site:
info@dannythedigger.com
www.dannythedigger.com

properties.name: Samaria-Sebasty
properties.description:
Biblical site. Originally a plot owned by shemer, but was purchased by Omri to turn into the capital of the Israelite tribes. In the first Century king Herod re-built the site. Excavations at the site by a joint team in the 1930's revealed remains of the Israelite palace, as well as various buildings (temple, agora, cardo) from the Roman period.

For more information about the site:
http://dannythedigger.com/jaffa-ta/samaria-sebasty

properties.name: Tel Balatah / Biblical Shechem
properties.description:
Major Biblical site in Samaria, inhabited to this day. In the Roman period it was named Neapolis (=New City), from which the modern name of city (Nablus) derives.Excavations at the tell revealed Canaanite period fortifications and a shrine. Parts of Roman Neapolis have been found under the modern city.

For more information about the site:
http://dannythedigger.com/tell-balata

properties.name: Neapolis / Schechem in Classical Times
properties.description:
During the Roman period the name of Schechem was changed to NEAPOLIS ("New city").
On both sides of the placemark you can see the alignment of the main steet (Cardo) that was designed then. At its western end the remains of the Roman period theatre are also visible.
The local population preserved the ancient Greek name of the city, and call it "Nablus".

For more information about the site:
http://dannythedigger.com/shechem

properties.name: Jacobs' well
properties.description:
A site near Biblical Schechem identified by Christian tradition to be in the plot bought by Jacob (Genesis 33:18-19), Where Jesus met a Samaritan woman (John 4:1-5). Indeed at the site there is a deep well. The construction of a church at the holy site was recently completed, although it began over a century ago..

For more information about the site:
http://dannythedigger.com/jacobs-well

properties.name: Mt Ebal - Joshua's Altar?
properties.description:
A unique site where A. Zartal of Haifa U. claims he foudn the remains of the Altar erected by Josuha:"Then Joshua built an altar unto the Lord, the God of Israel, in mount Ebal.., an altar of unhewn stones, upon which no man had lifted up any iron; and they offered thereon burnt-offerings unto the Lord, and sacrificed peace-offerings. And he wrote there upon the stones a copy of the law of Moses, which he wrote before the children of Israel" (Joshua 8:30-32).

However other scholars claim the site is nothing more then a watch tower..

For Zartal's work at the site see:http://ebal.haifa.ac.il/ebal01.html

For more information about the site:
info@dannythedigger.com
www.dannythedigger.com

properties.name: Salim
properties.description:
An Arab village 5 km east of Shechem, perhaps "Salim" mentioned in John 3:23.
Another option is that Shechem itself is "Salim". Both the Madaba map and Eusebius equate the two and state "Scheche, also Sikmia, also Salim". Similiar equasion is given also by the Septuagint (Gen. 33:18).
If indeed "Salim" is here or in Shechem, "Aenon" is perhaps at ein el-Phara'ah, a spring 9 km to the north, which is not too far from a site called "kh. Einun".Another option is to look for "Aenon" spring in one of the springs on the eastern side of Mt. Grizim.

- One scholar argues Aenon is near this village, at a site called "Ein el-Baidah".
If any one knows where it is please let me know!. Thank you. info@dannythedigger.com
www.dannythedigger.com

properties.name: Ein el-Baidah / Aenon?
properties.description:
A set of springs in Samaria, suggested by J. Scwartz to be the site of "Aenon near Salim" mentioned in John 3:23.
"Salim" could be Sechem, or the village of Salim, both 6 km S of the site.

For more information about the site:
info@dannythedigger.com
www.dannythedigger.com

properties.name: Ein el Pha'arah / Aenon?
properties.description:
A spring in Samaria, 9 km north of "Salim", and 1.5 km east of site called "Kh. Einun".
Some scholars argue this could be "Aenon near Salim" mentioned in John 3:23.

For more information about the site:
info@dannythedigger.com
www.dannythedigger.com

properties.name: Kh. Einun / Aenon?
properties.description:
A site of ruins 9 km north of Sechem suggested by W.F. Albright to be "Aenon near Salim" mentioned in John 3:23.
However the site has no water sources in its vicinity. The nearest spring is at ein el-phara'h, 1.5 km W. Furthermore the nearest candidate for "Salim" is Schechem itself, or and arab village named "Salim" 4.5 km E of Sechem. Both are not really "near" this site.
Yet to this day the site hasen't been excavated. Exposing the site would be able to determine if the famed Biblical archaeologist was right, or not.

For more information about the site:
info@dannythedigger.com
www.dannythedigger.com

properties.name: Tel Dothan
properties.description:
A Biblical site in Samaria. In its vicinity Joseph was watching his herd when his brothers cought him, threw him to a pit, and later sold him to Ishmaelite merchancts who took him to Egypt to be sold as a slave (Gen. 37).
In the middle ages the location of the pit was identified in GUB YUSUF, in the eastern Galilee.

For more information about the site:
info@dannythedigger.com
www.dannythedigger.com

properties.name: Megiddo Prison Church
properties.description:
A suprising ancient find revealed during renovations at an Israeli prison near Tel Megiddo. The structure revealed is from the late Roman period, but the mosaic floor contained inscriptions that indicate the users of the structures wer Christians!. If the dating is correct, this is the earliest Christian structure in the World!

For more information about the site:
info@dannythedigger.com
www.dannythedigger.com

properties.name: Tel Ta'anach
properties.description:
A Biblical site in northern Samaria, excavated in 1920's by Zellin.

For more information about the site:
info@dannythedigger.com
www.dannythedigger.com

properties.name: Tel Jezreel
properties.description:
Biblical site viewing the Jezreel valley. King Ahab had a palace at the site. Excavations by Ussishkin revealed parts of the fortifications of the site.

For more information about the site:
info@dannythedigger.com
www.dannythedigger.com

properties.name: Ein Harod
properties.description:
A spring at the bottom of the Gilboa mountain, famed for being the test site for the nature of Gideon's soldiers:
"So Gideon took the men down to the water. There the LORD told him, "Separate those who lap the water with their tongues like a dog from those who kneel down to drink." Three hundred men lapped with their hands to their mouths. All the rest got down on their knees to drink.

For more information about the site:
info@dannythedigger.com
www.dannythedigger.com

properties.name: Beth-Alpha Synagogue
properties.description:
A site in the Jezreel valley where Jewish pioneers founded a kibbutz in the 1920's, and while working to build the loca dinning room revealed an ancient synagogue mosaic floor from the Byzantine period.
The site was excavated by Y. Sukenik, and was a breakthrough in the research of ancient synagogues in Israel. The placemark is right on top of the building made over the mosaic floor.

For more information about the site:
http://dannythedigger.com/beth-alpha

properties.name: Rehov Synagogue
properties.description:
A site near Tel Rehov where a mosaic floor of a synagogue was found, dating to the Byzantine period.
The Mosaic contains a long inscription which the text of a certain Jewish religious text called "Braitat Tehumin".
The mosaic has been removed and is today displayed in Kibbutz Ein Hanatsiz, to north of the site.

For more information about the site:
info@dannythedigger.com
www.dannythedigger.com

properties.name: Tel Rehov
properties.description:
A Biblical site 5.5 km south of Beth-Shean.
Ongoing excavations at the site by A. Mazar traced various find from Canaanite and Israelite period.
You can clearly see the excavated areas to the left of the placemark.

For more information about the site:
info@dannythedigger.com
www.dannythedigger.com

properties.name: Tel Beit She'an
properties.description:
Biblical site, known as the place where the body of Saul was displaued after his lose to the Philistines. Excavations at the tel revealed an Egyptian mansion, a Roman temple, and a Christian church.

For more inforamation about the site:
http://dannythedigger.com/beit-shean

properties.name: Nyse-Scythopolis
properties.description:
Greko-Roman site developed in the valley south of Biblical Beth-Shean from the Hellenistic period. Large scale excavations sponsored by the ministery of tourism of the state of Israel revealed a well planned site, with a well preserved theatre, bath house, streets, and shrines.The site fell into ruins on the morning of 18th of JAnuary 749 by a devestating earthquake.

For more inforamation about the site:
http://dannythedigger.com/beit-shean

properties.name: Maoz Haim Ancient Synagogue
properties.description:
A site near Kibbutz Maoz Haim where an ancient Synagogue was found.

For more information about the site:
info@dannythedigger.com
www.dannythedigger.com

properties.name: Tel Menorah
properties.description:
A site right next to the entrance to religious Kibbutz Tirat Zvi, where a fragment of a menorah relief was found, indicating there was a religious Jewish community at the site in the Byzantine Period.

For more information about the site:
info@dannythedigger.com
www.dannythedigger.com

properties.name: Tel Rhadragh / Salim?
properties.description:
Canaanite site from the Early bronze period, but more known for yielding a bronze cuirass and head of the Empreror Trajan.Some scholars believe it is here where Abraham met Malki-Zedek (Gen. 14:18), and perhaps near the site should be Aenon, a site mentioned in the New testament as a place where John Baptised (John 3:23).E. Robinson documented in the 19th century that the locals called the site also "Welly seikh-Salim", and so perhaps preserving the ancient name of the site.I believe Aenon can be located near by, at kh. Khisas ed-dayr!. look for it, a bit SE!.

For more information about the site:
http://dannythedigger.com/aenon-near-salim

properties.name: Tel el-Hama / Abel Mechola?
properties.description:
An unexcavated Biblical site on the western bank of the Jordan, perhaps Biblical "Abel Mechola", hometwon of the prophet Elisha.
In this vicinity Elisha was appointed by Elijah to be a prophet and his successor (I Kings 19:16-21).

For more information about the site:
info@dannythedigger.com
www.dannythedigger.com

properties.name: Kh. khisas ed dayr / Aenon?
properties.description:
A site SE of Salim, which may have been the site where John the Baptist was active: "Now John also was baptizing at Aenon near Salim, because there was plenty of water" (John 3:23).
Indeed just left of the placemark you can see a water pool, and looke to the SW and you can see more pools!.
Survey at the site yielded Byzantine period pottery, but the site is still waiting to be excavated!!!
Being an archaologist and guide to many Christian sites, it is my dream for many years to dig at this spot. If you wish to sponsor this dig please contact me!!:
info@dannythedigger.com
www.dannythedigger.com

properties.name: Tel Abu-Sus / Abel Mechola?/ Aenon?
properties.description:
An unexcavated Biblical site on the western bank of the Jordan, perhaps Biblical "Abel Mechola", hometwon of the prophet Elisha.
In this vicinity Elisha was appointed by Elijah to be a prophet and his successor (I Kings 19:16-21).
Prof. Avi-Yonah suggests this is also the site of Aenon mentioned in John 3:23, and so the baptising was done in Jordan river.

For more information about the site:
info@dannythedigger.com
www.dannythedigger.com

properties.name: Tel Dor
properties.description:
Biblical site on the shores of the Mediterranean. Was an important port city in Canaanite times: An Egyptian officer Van Amun reported how he anchored at the city and lost all his possesions.. Developed to an adminstrative center in the time of Solomon (I Kings 4:11). Continued to florish in Roman times, when was named DWRA (=gift).Log lasting excavtions conducted at the site by E. Stern and I. Sharon.

For more information about the site:

properties.name: Akko / Ptolemais
properties.description:
https://www.youtube.com/embed/higVModIccc

Major port and city in northern Israel. In Biblical times Akk was a Phoenician port city (Judges 1:31). Ptolemy, founder of the Ptolemaic dynasty in Egypt, re-founded the city and re-named it after himself "Ptolemais”. The city developed much under Roman rule, and the apostle Paul spent a day in the city (Acts 21:7).
On 26 May 1104, after months of heavy siege and with the help of the Genoese fleet, the city fell into the hands of the Crusaders. The Crusaders constructed a sophisticated system of fortifications composed of walls and towers, and the city became a political and administrative until the expulsion of the Crusaders from the Holy Land in 1291.
The city played an important role also in 1799, when its local ruler, Jezzar Pasha, survived a siege by Napoleon, a lose that caused Napoleon to give up his ambition to rule the Near East and return to France.
To the right of the placemark you can clearly see the walls of Akko that stood against Napoleon.

For more information about the Site:
http://dannythedigger.com/akko

properties.name: Tel Akko
properties.description:
Site of Akko in Biblical times. In 1799 Napoleon used the tell to view at the walled port area. He failed to conquor Akko.
Perhaps it was because of the lousy view from this spot, to far and not high enough?...

For more information about the site:
http://dannythedigger.com/akko
